member.summary: The detail level for TopShelf's inventory data.

member.summary: Lists part and total QTY.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.DetailLevel.Low
member.summary: List inventory per client.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.DetailLevel.Medium
member.summary: List inventory per location.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.DetailLevel.High
member.summary: List inventory per bin.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.DetailLevel.Max
member.summary: List individual serial numbers for assets, and qtys per lot number for lots. No difference for items.

member.name: T:TopShelfAPI.StatusName
member.summary: Represents the state of s in TopShelf.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.StatusName.ShippedComplete
member.summary: The document is and has tracking info.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.StatusName.ShippedIncomplete
member.summary: The document is and has tracking info.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.StatusName.PickedComplete
member.summary: The document has all of it's items picked completely.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.StatusName.PickedIncomplete
member.summary: The document has items that are not completely picked.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.StatusName.ReceivedComplete
member.summary: The document has all of it's items completely received.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.StatusName.ReceivedIncomplete
member.summary: The document has items that are not completely received.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.StatusName.Open
member.summary: The document has not been opened by a user.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.StatusName.Canceled
member.summary: The document has been canceled and will not be picked.

member.name: T:TopShelfAPI.TSConfiguration
member.summary: Represents a configuration object used to define settings for communicating with TopShelf's REST API.

member.name: P:TopShelfAPI.TSConfiguration.EndpointURL
member.summary: Get or sets TopShelf's REST API URL, the default value is "https://api.scoutsft.com/"
member.exception: Is thrown if the url provided is null or blank.

member.name: P:TopShelfAPI.TSConfiguration.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time that will pass without a response after making a request.
member.exception: Is thrown if the provided is less than or equal to 0 milliseconds.

summary.para: Gets or sets how timeouts and reaching API limits is handled, if this is set to true then when an API limit is reached and the request cannot be made before the limit would reset, then a would be thrown. If it is set to false then the request will wait until the API limit allows for the request to be made.

However, at the moment because there are multiple timeouts in place, the request timeout itself that is controled when you call the method will still throw an exception if it takes too long to retrieve the data.

member.name: P:TopShelfAPI.TSConfiguration.ThrottleDataSaveFrequency

summary.para: Gets or sets the amount of time between each save of the throttle data json file. This file stores the number of requests made and when so that request limits will not be exceded even if the program is stopped and started.

member.exception: Is thrown if the provided is less than 500 milliseconds.

summary.para: Gets or sets your account's license type, this will affect the default request limits defined in . The request limits can be changed regardless of the license specified.

member.name: P:TopShelfAPI.TSConfiguration.RequestLimit
member.summary: Gets the current request limits defined for your connection. See .

member.name: T:TopShelfAPI.TSDefaults
member.summary: Represents the default variables for TopShelf.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.TSDefaults.DefaultDetailLevel
member.summary: The default level of detail that will be returned when requesting inventory data.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.TSDefaults.NullDateTime
member.summary: The string provided from TopShelf's REST API if the DateTime object is not set.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.TSDefaults.ThrottleDataFileName
member.summary: The name of the file that will be saved for all of the API's throttle data.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.TSDefaults.MaxPageSize
member.summary: The maximum number of items that can be returned from a single API call.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.TSDefaults.MediaType
member.summary: The type of content that is sent to TopShelf with POST, PUT and DELETE requests.

member.name: F:TopShelfAPI.TSDefaults.SuccessfulDeleteCode
member.summary: The HTTP status code that is returned when something is deleted successfully.

member.name: T:TopShelfAPI.TSRequestLimit
member.summary: The request limits that will be used to throttle requests to your account.

member.name: M:TopShelfAPI.TSRequestLimit.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new with the specified limits.
member.param: The maximum number of requests that will be sent to TopShelf in 60 seconds.
The maximum number of requests that will be sent to TopShelf in 24 hours.
member.exception: Will be thrown if or is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:TopShelfAPI.TSRequestLimit.MaxCallsPerMinute

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum number of requests that will be sent to TopShelf in 60 seconds.
You can set this to any non 0 positive number, but it is recommended that you keep this between 1 and 10 requests per minute to avoid possible errors.

member.exception: Will be thrown if the value provided is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:TopShelfAPI.TSRequestLimit.MaxCallsPerDay

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum number of requests that will be sent to TopShelf in 24 hours.
You can set this to any non 0 positive number, but this will vary depending on your account. Contact support@scoutsft.com to get information on your daily request limit.

member.exception: Will be thrown if the value provided is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:TopShelfAPI.TSRequestLimit.MaxConcurrentCalls

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent requests that can be sent to TopShelf.

It is recommended that this be left at 1, concurrent requests to TopShelf can cause deadlock errors. But if it is changed, it is recommended that you do not set it to be higher than the number of threads available - 1.

member.exception: Will be thrown if the value provided is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:TopShelfAPI.TSRequestLimit.MinDelayBetweenRequests

summary.para: Gets or sets the minimum amount of time to pause between requests, regardless of the current throttle, or the number of concurrent requests being made. The default value is 2 seconds.

It is recommended that you have atleast 2 seconds between requests, if you are making a lot of very large requests then you should allow for more time in-between each request. Setting this to 0 seconds might cause errors.

member.exception: Will be thrown if the provided is less than 0 seconds.
